1. Original Text

1.1. Official Extract

Released from Al-Matareya Health Bureau
Name and place of residence of the applicant Sheikh Mohammed Al-Sayyid Al-Najdi   Al-Matareya
The subject of which the extract is required Birth certificate of his son Ali
Extracted from the book of birth records of Al-Matareya Health Bureau   In the year 1926   Page 75   Part first
Date of permission to give the extract__________   In the year 192_   Number__________   Of__________  
Collected fees 0120 Millime Warrant number 114794 On 11th of April In the year 1926 Treasury of Al-Matareya Health Bureau

1.2. The Requested Extract

Upon searching, it was found that the aforementioned records affirmatively confirmed the presence on the date of the eighth of April of the year one-thousand nine-hundred (900)
and twenty six (6) AD under the number 274 the name Ali with the name of the father being Mohammed Al-Sayyid Al-Najdi
of a Muslim religion, Egyptian nationality, scientist as an occupation and the name of the mother being Zainab Soliman
Al-Rayyes of a Muslim religion, Egyptian nationality, none as an occupation dated
the eighth of November in the year one-thousand nine-hundred (900) AD...
The newborn was undocumented on birth, and executing upon a court ruling of the courthouse in Esna to which the Esna Prosecution office 5051
is affiliated, first number April of the year 1926 on 483

1.3. Footer

True copy  Released on 4/11In the year 1926 (Signature of the writer)
Handed over without the government’s responsibility whatsoever on what is included within and the rights of others
(Signature of the pen heads) (Signature of the head of the department or the manager or the governor)
Released on the 17th of April in the year 1926
Stamp of the body from which the extract was issued
(Amiri Press 6230/1920/15000)

2. Description and Breakdown

2.1. Who

This section describes the people mentioned within the document

  • Ali Mohammed El-Najdy
  • Sheikh Mohammed Al-Sayyid El-Najdi
  • Zainab Soliman Al-Rayyes
Name Relation Date of Birth Occupation
Ali Mohammed Al-Najdi Son 1900 Teacher/Schoolmaster
Mohammed Al-Sayyid Al-Najdi Father Unknown Scientist (Islamic Theologian)
Zainab Soliman Al-Rayyes Mother Unknown None

2.1.1. The Son

  • Ali Al-Najdi  8th of November 1900 Male

2.1.2. The Father

  • Sheikh Mohammed Al-Sayyed Al-Najdi  Unknown Male

2.1.3. The Mother

  • Zeinab Soliman Al-Rayyes  Unknown Female

2.1.4. Notes

  • Note: "Sheikh" in this context is not a name, but rather a title used to refer to an Islamic scholar or a person whose job is to lead the people in prayer (used interchangebly with Imam). Sometimes "Sheikh" refers to a person of old age, but is used to refer to an Islamic scholar in this case.
  • Note: "Al-Sayyed" in this context is not a name, but rather a title used to refer to a family name; the word is equivalent to "sir" in English
  • Note: The date of birth of the father and mother is unknown specifically, but it is believed to be around the 1870s-1880s
Note: The word scientist in this text refers to a scholar of Islamic theology, and often Sheikh in Al-Azhar mosque

2.2. When

2.2.1. Dates Mentioned

Date Significance
8th of April 1926 Date of performing the search within the records

2.3. Where

2.3.1. Name-Place References

The word "Al-Najdi" refers to someone who comes from Najd, which is the place that forms the center of what is now Saudi Arabia. Najdis, as people, predate Saudi Arabia as a nation and presence of tribes in the area predate many world civilizations dating back to the Neolithic era.

Originally, Najd was home to Al-Magar, an advanced culture dating back to the Neolithic era. Reminants of the civilization date back to 9000 BC

2.3.2. Map of Al-Matareya, Al-Daqahleya

2.3.3. Coordinates and Satellite View

These are the exact coordinates of the current location of Al Matareya Health Bureau, the old location has not been found
